definition: Puyi, personal name of the last Qing emperor (reigned as child 1909-1911), the subject of Bertolucci's biopic The Last Emperor
Empress Dowager Cixi or Ts'u Hsi (reigned 1861-1908)

An Dehai (-1869), the Qing equivalent of Rasputin, all-powerful court eunuch with the dowager empress Cixi 慈禧太后[Ci2 xi3 tai4 hou4], executed in 1869 by her rival Empress Mother Empress Dowager Ci'an 慈安皇太后
Cao Kun (1862-1938), one of the Northern Warlords
the Forbidden City/the Imperial Palace in Beijing/same as 故宮|故宫[Gu4 gong1]
Empress Dowager Cixi or Ts'u Hsi (1835-1908), regent 1861-1908
birth name of Qing emperor Guangxu 光緒|光绪[Guang1 xu4]
Zhu Zhanji, personal name of fifth Ming emperor Xuande 宣德[Xuan1 de2]
Aisin Gioro, family name of the Manchu emperors of the Qing dynasty
Grand Prince Yixin (1833-1898), sixth son of Emperor Daoguang, prominent politician, diplomat and modernizer in late Qing
personal name of fifteenth Ming emperor Tianqi 明天啟|明天启[Ming2 Tian1 qi3] (1605-1627), reigned 1620-1627
Manchu Restoration of 1917, an attempt by general 張勳|张勋[Zhanɡ1 Xun1] to reinstate the monarchy in China by restoring the abdicated emperor Puyi 溥儀|溥仪[Pu3 yi2] to the throne
a Qing prince who was the designated successor to emperor Guangxu until the Boxer uprising
